messages.subject: Re: What kind of homeschooler are you?
messages.msgSnippet: ... picked one just to pick it, but none of them were really right.  Don t pin me in, I am not a number, I m a free woman!  (Apologies to Patrick Doohan (?))
messages.messageBody:
--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, zenmomma@... wrote:
>
> >>The darned test doesn't have the right choices! Some of them, I
picked one just to pick it, but none of them were really right. Don't
pin me in, I am not a number, I'm a free woman! (Apologies to Patrick
Doohan (?))>>
>
> Yeah I thought the same thing. I had to stop taking it after 3
questions because NONE of the choices fit. I'm pretty sure I'm an
unschooler anyway. :o)
>

Ironically, it said I am, and I say I'm not -- I'm relaxed
eclectic.... Go figure.

Linda

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Re: What kind of homeschooler are you?
messages.msgSnippet: ... LOL I came up Swiss Family Robinson, too, mostly because darn it, I *do* have books on animal husbandry laying on my table and kitchen island and I *would*
messages.messageBody:
Paige wrote:

> > http://www.quizilla.com/users/guiltfree/quizzes/What%20Type%20of%
> 20Homesc
> > hooler%20Are%20You%3F
>
> I came out Swiss Family Robinison...but there just weren't enough
> options...the kids come up covered in mud? I just keep on with what
> I'm doing and don't bat an eye...unless they are really cute in their
> mud, then I take a picture (it's on my 'fridge). How is the house
> decorated? I don't have room for decorations, we are full just with
> our "stuff". lol What does it smell like? Ferret cage that hasn't
> been cleaned for two weeks and litter boxes that are being used by
> three cats...any questions?? They just didn't have answers that
> matched my life.



LOL I came up Swiss Family Robinson, too, mostly because darn it, I *do*
have books on animal husbandry laying on my table and kitchen island and
I *would* invite people over to see the baby chicks, though I don't know
that I'd compare them to parents or anything like that.

My husband said if the house "smells like your husband's farts" was not
an option then the quiz couldn't possibly reflect real life. ;)

--
~~Danielle
Emily (8), Julia (7), Sam (5)
http://www.danielleconger.com/Homeschool/Welcomehome.html

~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*

"With our thoughts, we make the world." ~~Buddha

messages.subject: Re: What kind of homeschooler are you?
messages.msgSnippet: ... wrote: but there just weren t enough ... Yeah, that one I kept thinking, Where s the response of Sure looks like they are having a good time ? Linda
messages.messageBody:
--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, "Paige" <paigehughes1972@...>
wrote:
but there just weren't enough
> options...the kids come up covered in mud?

Yeah, that one I kept thinking, "Where's the response of 'Sure looks
like they are having a good time'?"

Linda

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Re: What kind of homeschooler are you?
messages.msgSnippet: I agree about none of the answers being quite right. But I rejected several answers as things I definitely won t do and picked the one that was least unlikely
messages.messageBody:
I agree about none of the answers being quite right.
But I rejected several answers as things I definitely
won't do and picked the one that was least unlikely
KWIM? I ended up in the unschooler camp.

Manisha

messages.subject: Re: What kind of homeschooler are you?
messages.msgSnippet: I got Salvador Dali also. But I agree with what others said about not the right answers being there... but I love quizzes like that anyway so it was fun!
messages.messageBody:
I got Salvador Dali also. But I agree with what others said about not
the right answers being there... but I love quizzes like that anyway
so it was fun!

messages.subject: Re: What kind of homeschooler are you?
messages.msgSnippet: ... 20Homesc ... I came out Swiss Family Robinison...but there just weren t enough options...the kids come up covered in mud?  I just keep on with what I m
messages.messageBody:
> http://www.quizilla.com/users/guiltfree/quizzes/What%20Type%20of%
20Homesc
> hooler%20Are%20You%3F

I came out Swiss Family Robinison...but there just weren't enough
options...the kids come up covered in mud? I just keep on with what
I'm doing and don't bat an eye...unless they are really cute in their
mud, then I take a picture (it's on my 'fridge). How is the house
decorated? I don't have room for decorations, we are full just with
our "stuff". lol What does it smell like? Ferret cage that hasn't
been cleaned for two weeks and litter boxes that are being used by
three cats...any questions?? They just didn't have answers that
matched my life.
Paige

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] What kind of homeschooler are you?
messages.msgSnippet: Mine said: Salvador Dali Melting clocks are not a problem in your reality. You are an unschooler. You will tolerate a textbook, but only as a last resort. Mud
messages.messageBody:
Mine said:

"Salvador Dali Melting clocks are not a problem in your reality. You
are an unschooler. You will tolerate a textbook, but only as a last
resort. Mud is your friend. You prefer hands-on everything. If your
school had an anthem, it would be Dont Worry, Be Happy."



Ayup.


~Kelly

Kelly Lovejoy
Conference Coordinator
Live and Learn Unschooling Conference
http://liveandlearnconference.org

-----Original Message-----
From: Pampered Chef Michelle <pamperedmichelle@...>

http://www.quizilla.com/users/guiltfree/quizzes/What%20Type%20of%20Homesc
hooler%20Are%20You%3F

A fun little test. Be interesting to see if anyone comes up not an
unschooler. :)

Linda

I think these things are fun
this is what I got.

"Salvador Dali Melting clocks are not a problem in your reality. You
are an unschooler. You will tolerate a textbook, but only as a last
resort. Mud is your friend. You prefer hands-on everything. If your
school had an anthem, it would be Dont Worry, Be Happy. Visit my
blog: http://www.GuiltFreeHomeschooling.blogspot.com


1307 other people got this result!
This quiz has been taken 25174 times.
5% of people had this result."
